holidays.name: National Pencil Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the humble pencil, a tool that has sparked creativity and learning worldwide for centuries.
holidays.origin: National Pencil Day is celebrated on March 30 to mark the birthday of Nicholas-Jacques Conte, the inventor of the modern pencil in 1795.
holidays.funFact: The average pencil can draw a line approximately 35 miles long before it runs out of lead!

holidays.name: Take a Walk in the Park Day
holidays.description: Encourages people to slow down and enjoy a relaxing stroll in a nearby park to refresh mind and body.
holidays.origin: The origin is unclear, but it‚Äôs an unofficial day meant to promote wellness and outdoor activity as spring approaches in many regions.
holidays.funFact: Walking in green spaces has been shown to boost mood and creativity, so this day could improve your brainpower just with one walk!

holidays.name: Bunsen Burner Day
holidays.description: Honors the invention of the Bunsen burner, a staple piece of laboratory equipment essential for scientific experiments.
holidays.origin: Celebrated on the birthday of Robert Bunsen, the German chemist who invented the burner in 1855.
holidays.funFact: The Bunsen burner allows chemists to heat substances at a consistent and controllable flame, revolutionizing lab work forever.

holidays.name: Doctors' Day (India)
holidays.description: A day dedicated to honoring the contributions of doctors in India and recognizing their role in healthcare.
holidays.origin: Observed on the birthday of Dr. Bidhan Chandra Roy, a prominent physician and the second Chief Minister of West Bengal.
holidays.funFact: Dr. B.C. Roy was honored with the Bharat Ratna, India's highest civilian award, for his outstanding service in medicine and politics.
